Description: Part of a thin limestone slab (two fragments re-joined), probably from a trial- piece, with regular grids of slighlty different scale incised on both of the flat faces (squares of 2,2 cm on one face, 1,4 cm on the other face). One side of the object is preserved, showing a narrow border between the grid and the chamfered edges. The face with the grid of larger scale is virtually chipped away, but shows only a few lines and a wider border.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, Findspot 52 W (west?), south-eastern quarter of the Saite enclosure (so-called "Camp"), area of ironsmith's workshops.
Curator's comments: One of the "many pieces of designing tablets of limestone ruled in squares" mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 74 § 70 as "found in the camp and in a chamber of the fort". The mark "52 W" pencilled on the item indicates a provenance from Findspot 52 (west?), south-eastern quarter of the Saite enclosure (so-called "Camp"), area of ironsmith's workshops.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 74 § 70)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.58, p.179, pl.21)
